Schanda Tamás: senki sem vitathatja el tőlünk '56 dicsőségét
04 Nov 2019, 19:55 by Infostart / MTI
A nemzeti gyásznap, november 4. alkalmából az ország számos pontján rendeztek megemlékezést és gyújtottak mécseseket.
Hiába a kegyetlen megtorlás, hiába a vérvörös kommunizmus bosszúja, senki nem vitathatja el tőlünk, hogy a 20. század történelmében az 1956. október 23. és november 4. közötti dicsőséges két hét rólunk, magyarokról szólt - mondta Schanda Tamás, az Innovációs és Technológiai Minisztérium parlamenti államtitkára, a II. kerületi KDNP elnöke 2019. november 4-én, a nemzeti gyásznap alkalmából Budapesten, a Mansfeld-parkban.
A politikus arra is emlékeztetett, hogy bár 1956. november 4-én kezdetét vette a kommunista hatalom véres megtorlása, ennek ellenére voltak, akik kitartottak a küzdelemben.
"Tudták, nem nyerhetünk. És mégis folytatták a harcot, ki-ki lehetősége szerint tovább éltette az ellenállást az ördögi hatalommal szemben" - mondta, és felidézte Mansfeld Péter sorsát, akit a 18. születésnapja után pár nappal végeztetett ki a kommunista diktatúra.

Tamás Schanda: No one can deny us the glory of '56
04 Nov 2019, 19:55 by Infostart / MTI
On National Day, 4 November, commemorations and lit candles were held in many parts of the country.
Despite the brutal retribution, the revenge of blood-red communism, no one can deny us that in the history of the 20th century, the glorious two weeks between October 23 and November 4, 1956 were about us Hungarians, said Tamás Schanda, Innovation and Technology Parliamentary Under-Secretary of State, Department II. District KDNP President on November 4, 2019, on the occasion of National Funeral Day in Mansfeld Park, Budapest.
The politician also reminded that although the bloody retaliation of the communist power had begun on November 4, 1956, there were some who persisted in the struggle.
"They knew we couldn't win. And yet they continued to fight, who, as much as they could, continued to resist resistance to vicious power," he said, recalling the fate of Peter Mansfeld, executed a few days after his 18th birthday under communist dictatorship.
Tamás Schanda on Let's Build a Bridge! , II of Budapest. district and XVI. District attended a couple of events organized by Christian Democrats and NGOs in Buda.
At the Pest commemoration, at the statue and birthplace of Ilonka Tóth, the XVI. District Vice Mayor József Szász gave a solemn speech.


The candlesticks shaping the 1956 date on the 63rd anniversary of the suppression of the Revolution and War of Independence and the entry of Soviet troops in front of St. Stephen's Basilica on National Day, 4 November 2019. A memorial concert was held at the Basilica, Argentinian conductor José Cura conducted the Hungarian Radio Symphony Orchestra and Choir. MTI / Balázs Mohai

Tamás Deutsch: 1956 was about the supremacy of justice and freedom
BRUSSELS, MONDAY, NOVEMBER 4, 2019 - The history of Hungarian '56 was the most important and beautiful event of the difficult and ruthless 20th century. His message is clear and clear not only to Hungarians but also to the world at large: he is about the supremacy of justice and freedom, said Fidesz MEP Tamás Deutsch in Brussels on Monday.
In his speech at the event of the Hungarian People's Party of the European Parliament and the Hungarian Wave Society in memory of the 1956 revolution and its repression, the politician stressed that November 4 was one of the saddest days in the Hungarian nation's calendar.
